articles.title: MONTHLY BULLETIN
articles.summary: This document is the Monthly Bulletin for August 1971. It lists the club's key officers for that period, including Dave Erickson as President, Tom Halliday as Vice-President, Jerry Rattley as Secretary, and Emmet Murphy as Treasurer, along with their contact numbers.

articles.title: BOARD OF DIRECTORS
articles.summary: This document lists the members of a Board of Directors, detailing their years of service, contact phone numbers, and specific roles or areas of responsibility within the organization. The individuals listed include Dave Ambrose, Trudy E. Bell, Dick Glasspool, and Bruce Smith, among others, with roles such as 'Occultations,' 'bulletin,' 'librarian & observatory,' and 'observatory' specified.

articles.title: JULY 24 - OVERNIGHT STARPARTY
articles.summary: An overnight starparty is scheduled for July 24 at Henry Coe State Park. Attendees will pay a small fee ($1.50 per vehicle/campsite) and are encouraged to contact Emmet (287-6378) to coordinate rides and secure one of the limited campsites. Directions to the park, located 14 miles east of Morgan Hill, are also provided.

articles.title: JULY 31 - OVERNIGHT STARPARTY
articles.summary: An overnight star party is scheduled for Saturday, July 31, at the SJAA Observatory site, commencing at dusk. Emmet will coordinate the event and can be reached at 287-6378 for further details.

articles.title: AUGUST 3 - REGULAR MEETING
articles.summary: A regular meeting is scheduled for Friday, August 6, at 8 p.m. at the Community Bank, 111 W. St. John St., 2nd floor, Executive Conference Room. Trudy E. Bell will be the featured speaker, presenting a talk titled "Are You Sure This is the Right Star? (Or Avoiding Angry Neighbors, Vicious Dogs, and Wary Cops While Making Like a Professional)".

articles.title: Page 2
articles.summary: An upcoming meeting will feature Trudy presenting on the observing techniques, uses, and history of grazes and occultations, including results from a July 4 graze. Attendees are also invited to discuss the outcomes of recent starparties held in June and July, with a possible film available by the August meeting.

articles.title: AUGUST 13 - PLANNING MEETING -
articles.summary: A planning meeting is scheduled for August 13th at Tom Halliday's residence in San Jose. The primary objectives of this meeting are to finalize the fall and winter activity calendars and to outline the major efforts required for observatory development.

articles.title: AUGUST 21 - OVERNIGHT STARPARTY (FOR THOSE NOT HOLDING LUAUS)
articles.summary: An overnight starparty is scheduled for Saturday, August 21, at the SJAA observatory site, beginning at dusk. Dave will coordinate the event, and he can be reached at 269-4338 for further details.

articles.title: AUGUST 27 - PUBLIC STARPARTY
articles.summary: SJAA is hosting a public star party on August 27 at the Skyline Site, following a previous event that was canceled due to clouds. Members are encouraged to attend and showcase their astronomical equipment to the public.

articles.title: AUGUST 28 - MOONWATCH
articles.summary: The article announces two public astronomy events for the upcoming weekend: a star party on Friday and a moonwatch on Saturday at the SJAA observatory site. Attendees are encouraged to participate in at least one event, with options for those who can only make Saturday, and an invitation for eager individuals to attend both.

articles.title: OUTDOOR FEAST
articles.summary: The article describes a successful outdoor banquet, or "Outdoor Feast," hosted by a club, with ample food and drinks provided by numerous contributors and attended by over fifty people. Despite initial cloud cover hindering some early viewing, the clouds eventually cleared, and the club acquired a new barbecue grill for future use during the summer months.

articles.title: NORTHERN CALIFORNIA ASTRONOMY PLANNING MEETING
articles.summary: Northern California astronomy groups are initiating a collaborative effort to coordinate regional activities. This includes pooling resources for event announcements, handling last-minute updates through John Dobson's San Francisco location, and planning a major astronomy convention akin to the Riverside event, with support from San Jose.

articles.title: FREMONT PEAK RESULTS (June 19)
articles.summary: The article reports on a successful stargazing event at Fremont Peak on June 19, featuring clear skies, a prominent Milky Way, numerous telescopes, and observations of Jupiter. It also briefly covers SJAA's renewed membership with the Astronomical Society of the Pacific, plans for a seismic station at the observatory, and a call for submissions to the bulletin.
